sub_topic: Determining the bond enthalpy of a molecule
message_1:
Sure, here's a question for a chemistry student to solve on determining the bond enthalpy of a molecule:

Determine the bond enthalpy of the single bond in a molecule of ethane (C2H6), if 282 kJ of energy is required to break a mole of this bond.
message_2:
To determine the bond enthalpy of the single bond in a molecule of ethane (C2H6), we need to consider the energy required to break one mole of the C-C bond.

Ethane (C2H6) has the following structure:

H H H
| | |
C-C
| | |
H H H

There is one C-C single bond in the ethane molecule.

Given that 282 kJ of energy is required to break a mole of this bond, the bond enthalpy of the single bond in a molecule of ethane is simply 282 kJ/mol.
